;Recently, a piece of news about “teacher asking students to order milk” has attracted attention. On September 7, parents in Suiping County, Zhumadian, Henan Province broke the news that a primary school teacher posted a message about students ordering milk. A screenshot of the chat in the online post showed that a teacher sent a message saying that if a child cannot drink school milk due to a certain disease, Parents need to provide proof of diagnosis and treatment from a county hospital or above medical institution. The teacher also said that there are 53 students in the class, 15 of whom have completed the registration process, and he hopes that the parents of the remaining 38 students will "actively cooperate with the work."

;

;This news triggered a wave of public opinion as soon as it was exposed. The teacher's words are suspected of "forced ordering of milk", which seems to be "unsightly". The style of "forced buying and selling" has also aroused doubts and ridicule from netizens, awakening everyone to "order milk" and "order teaching materials". "Childhood memories" of ordering designated books. In particular, the words "unless you prove to be sick, you must order milk" and "do you expect the teacher to treat 53 children equally" were even threatening, which attracted a lot of negative comments from the public.

;

;Relevant departments in Suiping County stated on September 8 that the County Education Bureau had investigated clearly on the 7th that the matter was the "personal behavior" of a class teacher at the Central Primary School in Shenzhai Town, Suiping County. "Medical Certificate" is also an inappropriate statement by the teacher personally. At the same time, only this class has mandatory requirements, and other classes are voluntary. At present, the county education bureau has criticized the teacher and asked the teacher to apologize to the parents.

;

;This is not the only "milk ordering incident" in Zhumadian recently. On September 7, a parent in Zhengyang County broke the news that a primary school teacher said that he "actively orders if there are conditions, but creates conditions to order if there are no conditions." Judging from the screenshots of the WeChat group posted online, the teacher posted "Milk Man" in the WeChat group Everyone needs to order!" message, and said that "taking into account the financial pressure of parents", the "milk ordering quota" for each semester has changed from the original "440 yuan for a full portion of 4 boxes" to "per school consultation". People only order 3 boxes for a total of 330 yuan.”

;

;On September 8, the principal of the school said that ordering milk was on a voluntary basis, and the teacher’s wording was wrong, and a meeting would be held again to study it; a staff member of the local education bureau said that the higher-level department required ordering milk for the healthy growth of students. , but following the principle of parent voluntariness; the Education Bureau stated in a briefing on September 8 that the problems reported by netizens were basically true, and that the class had deviations in its interpretation of the spirit of superior documents and was suspected of violating the principle of voluntary subscription, so it would immediately suspend the promotion of drinking milk. work, rectify and standardize it, and investigate and deal with relevant responsible personnel.

;

;Almost at the same time, two "personal acts" of teachers forcing students to order milk occurred in Zhumadian. Looking at the timeline of the two incidents, it can be said that they are similar; the same trend followed. The "mandatory ordering of milk" was considered to be the teacher's "personal behavior". At the same time, it was insisted that the milk ordering work for students followed the principle of voluntariness. However, upon careful review of these two incidents, there are still some questions that need to be analyzed and questioned.

;

;First, when teachers ask students to order milk, is it really their "personal behavior"?

;

;In the screenshots exposed in the two incidents, the Zhengyang County teacher mentioned that "after consultation with the school", the Zhengyang County Education Bureau clearly stated in the briefing that this was a "deviation in interpretation" of "superior documents". Without these "documents" being suppressed, what motivation would a mere elementary school teacher have to turn into a salesman? Why would there be any need to issue vague intimidation and inducement to many parents such as "create conditions if there are no conditions" and "order milk if you are not sick"?

;

;In the two incidents, if the teacher risked misinterpreting superior documents to do something that prompted parents to report it, what was the purpose behind it? If there is no profit motive to support it, the argument of "personal behavior" will obviously be more difficult to establish. In the case of conflicts between "superior documents" and "voluntary principles", how can teachers grasp "personal behavior" in order to satisfy both superiors and parents at the same time?

;

;Therefore, it is necessary for the education department to publish the original text of the "superior document" originally issued, or to announce to the public what the specific instructions for the "project" of milk subscription are, so that it can be clearer.

;

;Secondly, the two "forced milk ordering" incidents also show that grassroots teachers bear too many non-teaching burdens in their daily work, which is a major root cause of many similar incidents.

;

;Under the current education system, teachers, as actual grassroots personnel and the end of the power chain, have a rather embarrassing situation of "little power but big responsibility": this "responsibility" is to be responsible to the superiors, not to the superiors. Responsible to parents and students; the "higher-level departments" are responsible for issuing instructions and issuing notices, but in practice they have "great power but little responsibility". They have great power but are not responsible for students.

;

;For a long time, grassroots teachers have taken on too many additional tasks that are not part of teaching. The DingTalk group on the left, the WeChat group on the right, check-in today, receipt tomorrow, cultural performance here, textbook subscription there, resulting in a considerable amount of time and energy being occupied by non-teaching tasks, seriously affecting the duties of teaching and educating people. Even grassroots teachers often have to transmit top-down pressure to parents.

;

;Take these two incidents as an example. Regardless of whether the subscription of milk for students is reasonable or not, this task should not be left to teachers in the first place. There are a lot of administrative staff in the education system. It would undoubtedly be much better for them to be responsible for taking care of students' health and choosing better dairy products than to impose an irrelevant responsibility on teachers out of thin air.

;

;Teachers in primary and secondary schools should be freed from the imposed non-educational burdens, focus on teaching and educating people, and better serve students rather than superiors. Otherwise, teachers will be allowed to do all kinds of things if nothing happens. When something has nothing to do with teaching, it is regarded as "teacher's personal behavior". This is too bullying.
